name: Oh...Sir! Prototype
description: A Ridiculous local 1v1muliplayer Insult Simulator for two!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP or Later Processor: Intel from 1.2 GHz or equivilent AMD family Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: DirectX 9 compatible graphics card DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 70 MB available space

reviews.review_text: 'Your mother still uses Windows Vista' 10/10 best insult

It's too bad this is not a full fleged game, there was really potential for a fun cross between Monty Python and Cards Against Humanity here. But in its current state, it is amusing for 10min and not even as deep as the insult challenges in the original Monkey Island game. With better voice acting, and a 100 times more bits of insults to work with, this could actually be a real game that I would pay money for.  But hey, this was made in 48h and is free, and for that you get an interesting idea, and 10 min of fun, I've gotten worse deals on Steam.
The Most Advanced Simulation Game Up To Date. Also, 'Never Watched Star Wars' and 'Still Uses Windows Vista' is an insult.
'Your father works with the Nazis and has never watched Star Wars' 10/10
'Your hat talks to strangers, and has tiny feet. I have proof.' If somone said that to me I would tip my fedora to them, and leave. 10/10
dissapointingly this game has no online multiplayer, also its really bad, so bad that its good and since its free i have to reccomend it just so you can love how bad it is.
Got roasted so hard I cried. 10/10
it has been several games the upper score threshold has yet to be realised we must go deeper see if there is a  score greater than  25

This game is perfect in every way. If you've ever wanted to destroy someone's honour by telling them that their favourite Bond actor is filled with eels, then this game is for you. It's also free. It also takes up about 85mb of space on your computer.

A quite silly game that you can play with your friends. Unforunatly, there is no online multiplayer, so you won't be able to play with people that aren't in the same room as you.

This game is, overall a fun, quick, local multiplayer game, with a few problems though, the tea doesn't regenerate, even when you restart the game, so use it wisely. Second problem, there's no menu. You can't pause. But other than that, it's fun but very quick.
Worth your time for a quick laugh.

This game is hirlarious but only supports local multiplayer and has no settings.  Quit the game by pressing Escape (Esc).  You can insult someone by saying: 'This parrot is full of eels and still uses Windows Vista!'  6/10 it alright, just not subtle or nuanced. Give it a try if you like!

Ive never felt more insulted in my entire life...

Good concept, horrible execution.  Minor Things:  1: Hands make this game have a concept of luck. 2: Voice was recorded in an airplane. 3: Audio is incredibly buggy (at least on the Mac port, but since this is made in unity...). 4: Lack of keyboard controls means that both players either need to share the same mouse (or whatever you use) or two mice, either way allowing for tons of cheating.  Major Things:  1: The scoring system. It's broken. Really, really broken. My opponent insulted me by saying 'That dog is a english dog pig, I bet!' (which would actually harm his own health) and I insulted him by saying 'You are vile, sir!' and he scored a ton more than me. If you don't see what's wrong there... 2: Some word combinations that should work don't, such as 'Your hovercraft talks to strangers and your hat, mate!' doesn't work because it wants a verb after 'your hat', so when I tried picking 'mate!' it damaged me for making a bad choice... what!? 3: You know what I said about the airplane this game was made in? Yeah, it's also a major thing.  This is just an overview of the several problems I encountered while playing this for about half an hour. If your game's point is to have revolutionary game mechanics, yet those same mechanics are broken to the core... your game truly sucks. As I said, good concept, horrible execution. If these problem were fixed (which I doubt as games made within a timelimit don't tend to update), this game would be great. I just don't want to bother anymore because I'll get less points for saying something short and direct ('You and your father are vile!') versus something longer and completely stupid and irrelevant ('That dog is a dead parrot, and I have proof!'). WHICH MAKES NO SENSE FOR A GAME WHOSE ENTIRE GAMEPLAY REVOLVES AROUND THIS MECHANIC

This is horrible. I was interested by the description of the game is just horrible. It was loud and I found no way ingame to turn it down. 0/10 Deleting System32 to make sure this is completly unistalled.
